texts.tl: Maka titah <> Yusuf: Dijauhkan <> Allah kiranya aku dari pada berbuat <> demikian <>, melainkan orang <> yang telah <> didapati <> piala <> itu dalam tangannya <>, itu juga <> akan menjadi <> hambaku <>, tetapi kamu <> sekalian berjalanlah naik <> dengan selamat <> kepada <> bapamu <>.
texts.ende: Tetapi ia menjahut: "Djauhlah dari padaku akan berbuat demikian! Orang jang kedapatan membawa piala itu, akan mendjadi budakku. Adapun kamu, pulanglah kepada ajahmu dengan amannja".
texts.bbe: Then he said, Far be it from me to do so: but the man who had my cup will be my servant; and you may go back to your father in peace.

Judah’s speech begins with the fear and trembling of one who stands condemned. Joseph has as much power as Pharaoh, either to condemn or to pardon. Judah will make his appeal, wording his speech in such a way as to appeal to Joseph’s compassion for the father, whom he mentions no less than fourteen times in the speech.

The tension remains as to how the brothers’ wickedness and God’s intentions work together. Clearly God is able to transform the actions of wickedness to bring about some gracious end. But this is saying more than that; it is saying that from the beginning it was God who sent Joseph here. Although harmonization of these ideas remains humanly impossible, the divine intention is what should be the focus. Only that will enable reconciliation. ahead of you to preserve life!

texts.tl: Maka Yakubpun <> berangkatlah <> dari Birsyeba <>, dihantar <> oleh bani <> Israel <> akan Yakub <>, bapanya <>, dan akan anak-anaknya <> dan akan segala <> bininya <> dengan naik pedati <>, yang telah <> dikirim oleh <> Firaun <> supaya membawa <> akan dia <>.
texts.ende: Jakub lalu berangkat dari Beersjeba. Dan anak-anak Israel menaikkan Jakub ajah mereka, anak-anak serta isteri-isteri mereka diatas kereta-kereta, jang telah dikirimkan Parao untuk mengangkutnja.
texts.bbe: Then Jacob went on from Beer-sheba; and the sons of Jacob took their father and their little ones and their wives in the carts which Pharaoh had sent for them.
texts.message: Then Jacob left Beersheba. Israel's sons loaded their father and their little ones and their wives on the wagons Pharaoh had sent to carry him.
texts.nkjv: Then Jacob arose from Beersheba; and the sons of Israel carried their father Jacob, their little ones, and their wives, in the carts which Pharaoh had sent to carry him.
texts.net: Then Jacob started out2823  Heb “arose.” from Beer Sheba, and the sons of Israel carried their father Jacob, their little children, and their wives in the wagons that Pharaoh had sent along to transport him.

texts.tb: Mereka membawa <> juga ternaknya <> dan harta <> bendanya, yang <> telah diperoleh <> mereka di tanah <> Kanaan <>, lalu tibalah <> mereka di Mesir <>, yakni Yakub <> dan seluruh <> keturunannya <> bersama-sama <> dengan dia.
texts.bis: Mereka juga membawa ternak dan segala harta benda yang telah mereka peroleh di Kanaan, lalu berangkat ke Mesir. Yakub membawa seluruh keturunannya, yaitu
texts.tl: Maka dibawalah <> oleh mereka itu sertanya akan segala binatangnya <> dan segala harta <> bendanya, yang telah <> diperolehnya <> dalam negeri <> Kanaan <> itu, lalu datanglah <> ia ke Mesir <>, yaitu Yakub <> dan segala <> anak cucunyapun <> sertanya <>:
texts.ende: Mereka membawa kawanan mereka dan harta-benda, jang telah mereka peroleh ditanah Kanaan, dan mereka sampai ke Mesir, jaitu Jakub bersama seluruh keturunannja.
texts.bbe: And they took their cattle and all the goods which they had got in the land of Canaan, and came to Egypt, even Jacob and all his seed:
texts.message: They arrived in Egypt with the livestock and the wealth they had accumulated in Canaan. Jacob brought everyone in his family with him
texts.nkjv: So they took their livestock and their goods, which they had acquired in the land of Canaan, and went to Egypt, Jacob and all his descendants with him.
texts.net: Jacob and all his descendants took their livestock and the possessions they had acquired in the land of Canaan, and they went to Egypt.2824  Heb “and they took their livestock and their possessions which they had acquired in the land of Canaan and they went to Egypt, Jacob and all his offspring with him.” The order of the clauses has been rearranged in the translation for stylistic reasons.

texts.tb: Anak-anak <> dan cucu-cucunya <> laki-laki dan perempuan <>, seluruh <> keturunannya <> dibawanyalah ke <> Mesir <>.
texts.bis: semua anak cucunya laki-laki dan perempuan.
texts.tl: anak-anaknya <> laki-laki <> dan cucunya laki-laki <> serta <> anak-anaknya perempuan <> dan cucunya perempuan <>, yang dari pada anak-anaknya <> laki-laki, dan segala <> anak buahnyapun <> dibawanya <> sertanya <> ke Mesir <>.
texts.ende: Putera-puteranja bersama anak-anak mereka, dan puteri-puterinja bersama tjutju-tjutjunja perempuan dan seluruh keturunannja dibawanja ke Mesir.
texts.bbe: His sons and his sons� sons, his daughters and his daughters� sons and all his family he took with him into Egypt.
texts.message: --sons and grandsons, daughters and granddaughters. Everyone.
texts.nkjv: His sons and his sons' sons, his daughters and his sons' daughters, and all his descendants he brought with him to Egypt.
texts.net: He brought with him to Egypt his sons and grandsons,2825  The Hebrew text adds “with him” here. This is omitted in the translation because it is redundant in English style (note the same phrase earlier in the verse). his daughters and granddaughters – all his descendants.

texts.tb: Inilah <> nama-nama <> bani <> Israel <> yang datang <> ke Mesir <>, yakni Yakub <> beserta keturunannya. Anak <> sulung <> Yakub <> ialah Ruben <>.
texts.bis: Anggota-anggota keluarga Yakub yang turut ke Mesir ialah:
texts.tl: Maka inilah <> nama-nama <> bani <> Israel <> yang datang <> ke Mesir <>, yaitu Yakub <> dan anak-anaknya <> laki-laki; maka yang sulung <> yaitu <> Rubin <>,
texts.ende: Inilah nama anak-anak Israel jang datang ke Mesir, jakni Jakub dan anak-anaknja. Ruben anak sulung Jakub.
texts.bbe: And these are the names of the children of Israel who came into Egypt, even Jacob and all his sons: Reuben, Jacob�s oldest son;
texts.message: These are the names of the Israelites, Jacob and his descendants, who went to Egypt: Reuben, Jacob's firstborn.
texts.nkjv: Now these [were] the names of the children of Israel, Jacob and his sons, who went to Egypt: Reuben [was] Jacob's firstborn.
texts.net:
These are the names of the sons of Israel who went to Egypt – Jacob and his sons:
Reuben, the firstborn of Jacob.

texts.tb: Anak-anak <> Ruben <> ialah Henokh <>, Palu <>, Hezron <> dan Karmi <>.
texts.bis: Ruben, anak sulung; anak-anaknya: Henokh, Palu, Hezron dan Karmi.
texts.tl: dan anak-anak <> laki-laki Rubin <>, yaitu Hanokh <> dan Palu <> dan Hezron <> dan Karmi <>.
texts.ende: Anak-anak Ruben ialah Henoch, Pallu, Chesron dan Karmi.
texts.bbe: And the sons of Reuben: Hanoch and Pallu and Hezron and Carmi;
texts.message: Reuben's sons: Hanoch, Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi.
texts.nkjv: The sons of Reuben [were] Hanoch, Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi.
texts.net:
The sons of Reuben:
Hanoch, Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi.

texts.tb: Anak-anak <> Simeon <> ialah Yemuel <>, Yamin <>, Ohad <>, Yakhin <> dan Zohar <> serta Saul <>, anak <> seorang perempuan Kanaan <>.
texts.bis: Simeon; anak-anaknya: Yemuel, Yamin, Ohad, Yakhin, Zohar dan Saul, anak dari istrinya seorang wanita Kanaan.
texts.tl: Maka anak-anak <> laki-laki Simeon <>, yaitu Yemuil <> dan Yamin <> dan Ohad <> dan Yakhin <> dan Zohar <>, dan Saul <>, yaitu anak <> laki-laki dari pada seorang perempuan Kanani <>.
texts.ende: Anak-anak Sjimeon ialah Jemuel, Jamin, Ohad, Jakin, Sochar, dan Sjaul, anak seorang perempuan Kanaan.
texts.bbe: And the sons of Simeon: Jemuel and Jamin and Ohad and Jachin and Zohar and Shaul, the son of a woman of Canaan;
texts.message: Simeon's sons: Jemuel, Jamin, Ohad, Jakin, Zohar, and Shaul the son of a Canaanite woman.
texts.nkjv: The sons of Simeon [were] Jemuel, Jamin, Ohad, Jachin, Zohar, and Shaul, the son of a Canaanite woman.
texts.net:
The sons of Simeon:
Jemuel, Jamin, Ohad, Jakin, Zohar, 
and Shaul (the son of a Canaanite woman).

texts.tb: Anak-anak <> Lewi <> ialah Gerson <>, Kehat <> dan Merari <>.
texts.bis: Lewi; anak-anaknya: Gerson, Kehat dan Merari.
texts.tl: Maka anak-anak <> laki-laki Lewi <>, yaitu Gerson <> dan Kehat <> dan Merari <>.
texts.ende: Anak-anak Levi ialah Gersjon, Kehat dan Merari.
texts.bbe: And the sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari;
texts.message: Levi's sons: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
texts.nkjv: The sons of Levi [were] Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
texts.net:
The sons of Levi:
Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.

texts.tb: Anak-anak <> Yehuda <> ialah Er <>, Onan <>, Syela <>, Peres <> dan Zerah <>; tetapi Er <> dan Onan <> mati <> di tanah <> Kanaan <>; dan anak-anak <> Peres <> ialah Hezron <> dan Hamul <>.
texts.bis: Yehuda; anak-anaknya: Syela, Peres dan Zerah, sedangkan anak Yehuda yang lain, yaitu Er dan Onan meninggal di Kanaan. Anak-anak Peres: Hezron dan Hamul.
texts.tl: Maka anak-anak <> laki-laki Yehuda <>, yaitu Er <> dan Onan <> dan Syela <> dan Paris <> dan Zerah <>; akan tetapi Er <> dan Onan <> itu sudah mati <> di negeri <> Kanaan <>. Maka <> anak <> laki-laki Paris <>, yaitu Hezron <> dan Hamul <>.
texts.ende: Anak-anak Juda ialah Er, Onan, Sjela, Peres dan Zerach. Tetapi Er dan Onan sudah mati ditanah Kanaan. Anak-anak Peres ialah Chesron dan Chamul.
texts.bbe: And the sons of Judah: Er and Onan and Shelah and Perez and Zerah: but Er and Onan had come to their death in the land of Canaan; and the sons of Perez were Hezron and Hamul.
texts.message: Judah's sons: Er, Onan, Shelah, Perez, and Zerah (Er and Onan had already died in the land of Canaan). The sons of Perez were Hezron and Hamul.
texts.nkjv: The sons of Judah [were] Er, Onan, Shelah, Perez, and Zerah (but Er and Onan died in the land of Canaan). The sons of Perez were Hezron and Hamul.
texts.net:
The sons of Judah:
Er, Onan, Shelah, Perez, and Zerah
(but Er and Onan died in the land of Canaan).
The sons of Perez were Hezron and Hamul.

texts.tb: Anak-anak <> Isakhar <> ialah Tola <>, Pua <>, Ayub <> dan Simron <>.
texts.bis: Isakhar; anak-anaknya: Tola, Pua, Ayub dan Simron.
texts.tl: Maka anak-anak <> laki-laki Isakhar <>, yaitu Tola <> dan Pua <> dan Ayub <> dan Simron <>.
texts.ende: Anak-anak Issakar ialah Tola, Puwwa, Job dan Sjimron.
texts.bbe: And the sons of Issachar: Tola and Puah and Job and Shimron;
texts.message: Issachar's sons: Tola, Puah, Jashub, and Shimron.
texts.nkjv: The sons of Issachar [were] Tola, Puvah, Job, and Shimron.
texts.net:
The sons of Issachar:
Tola, Puah,2826  The MT reads “Puvah” (cf. Num 26:23); the Samaritan Pentateuch and Syriac read “Puah” (cf. 1 Chr 7:1). Jashub,2827  The MT reads “Iob,” but the Samaritan Pentateuch and some LXX mss read “Jashub” (see Num 26:24; 1 Chr 7:1). and Shimron.

texts.tb: Anak-anak <> Zebulon <> ialah Sered <>, Elon <> dan Yahleel <>.
texts.bis: Zebulon; anak-anaknya: Sered, Elon dan Yahleel.
texts.tl: Maka anak-anak <> laki-laki Zebulon <>, yaitu Sered <> dan Elon <> dan Yahliel <>.
texts.ende: Anak-anak Zebulon ialah Sered, Elon dan Jachleel.
texts.bbe: And the sons of Zebulun: Sered and Elon and Jahleel;
texts.message: Zebulun's sons: Sered, Elon, and Jahleel.
texts.nkjv: The sons of Zebulun [were] Sered, Elon, and Jahleel.
texts.net:
The sons of Zebulun:
Sered, Elon, and Jahleel.

texts.tb: Itulah <> keturunan <> Lea <>, yang <> melahirkan <> bagi Yakub <> di Padan-Aram <> anak-anak <> lelaki <> serta <> Dina <> juga, anaknya <> yang perempuan. Jadi seluruhnya <>, laki-laki <> dan perempuan <>, berjumlah <> tiga <> puluh tiga <> jiwa.
texts.bis: Mereka semua adalah anak-anak yang dilahirkan oleh Lea bagi Yakub di Mesopotamia, selain itu juga anaknya perempuan yang bernama Dina. Jadi seluruh keturunan Yakub dari istrinya Lea berjumlah tiga puluh tiga orang.
texts.tl: Maka sekalian inilah <> anak-anak <> laki-laki Lea <>, yang <> diperanakkannya <> bagi Yakub <> di Padan-Aram <>; dan lagi Dinah <>, anaknya perempuan <> itu. Maka segala <> anak-anaknya <> laki-laki dan perempuan <> itu sekalian <> tiga <> puluh tiga <> orang banyaknya <>.
texts.ende: Itulah anak-anak laki-laki, jang telah dilahirkan Lea bagi Jakub di Paddan Aram, dan lagi Dina, anaknja perempuan. Djumlah anak-anak laki-laki dan anak-anaknja perempuan ada tigapuluh tiga orang.
texts.bbe: All these, together with his daughter Dinah, were the children of Leah, whom Jacob had by her in Paddan-aram; they were thirty-three in number.
texts.message: These are the sons that Leah bore to Jacob in Paddan Aram. There was also his daughter Dinah. Altogether, sons and daughters, they numbered thirty-three.
texts.nkjv: These [were] the sons of Leah, whom she bore to Jacob in Padan Aram, with his daughter Dinah. All the persons, his sons and his daughters, [were] thirtythree.
texts.net: These were the sons of Leah, whom she bore to Jacob in Paddan Aram, along with Dinah his daughter. His sons and daughters numbered thirty-three in all.2828  Heb “all the lives of his sons and his daughters, thirty-three.”

texts.tb: Anak-anak <> Gad <> ialah Zifyon <>, Hagi <>, Syuni <>, Ezbon <>, Eri <>, Arodi <> dan Areli <>.
texts.bis: Gad; anak-anaknya: Zifyon, Hagi, Syuni, Ezbon, Eri, Arodi dan Areli.
texts.tl: Maka anak-anak laki-laki <> Gad <>, yaitu Zifeyon <> dan Hagi <> dan Syumi <> dan Izbon <> dan Eri <> dan Arodi <> dan Areli <>.
texts.ende: Anak-anak Gad ialah Sifjon, Chaggi, Sjuni, Esbon, Eri, Arodi dan Areli.
texts.bbe: And the sons of Gad: Ziphion and Haggi, Shuni and Ezbon, Eri and Arodi and Areli;
texts.message: Gad's sons: Zephon, Haggi, Shuni, Ezbon, Eri, Arodi, and Areli.
texts.nkjv: The sons of Gad [were] Ziphion, Haggi, Shuni, Ezbon, Eri, Arodi, and Areli.
texts.net:
The sons of Gad:
Zephon,2829  The MT reads “Ziphion,” but see Num 26:15, the Samaritan Pentateuch and the LXX, all of which read “Zephon.” Haggi, Shuni, Ezbon, Eri, Arodi, and Areli.

texts.tb: Anak-anak <> Asyer <> ialah Yimna <>, Yiswa <>, Yiswi <> dan Beria <>; Serah <> ialah saudara <> perempuan mereka; dan anak-anak <> Beria <> ialah Heber <> dan Malkiel <>.
texts.bis: Asyer; anak-anaknya: Yimna, Yiswa, Yiswi dan Beria serta Serah, saudara perempuan mereka. Anak-anak Beria ialah Heber dan Malkiel.
texts.tl: Maka anak-anak <> laki-laki Asyer <>, yaitu Yimna <> dan Yiswa <> dan Yiswi <> dan Beria <> dan Sera <>, saudara <> perempuan mereka itu. Maka anak-anak <> laki-laki Beraya <>, yaitu Heber <> dan Malkhiel <>.
texts.ende: Anak-anak Asjer ialah Jimna, Jisjwa, Jisjwi, Beri'a dan lagi Serah, saudara perempuan mereka. Anak-anak Beri'a ialah Cheber dan Malkiel.
texts.bbe: And the sons of Asher: Jimnah and Ishvah and Ishvi and Beriah, and Sarah, their sister; and the sons of Beriah: Heber and Malchiel.
texts.message: Asher's sons: Imnah, Ishvah, Ishvi, and Beriah. Also their sister Serah, and Beriah's sons, Heber and Malkiel.
texts.nkjv: The sons of Asher [were] Jimnah, Ishuah, Isui, Beriah, and Serah, their sister. And the sons of Beriah [were] Heber and Malchiel.
texts.net:
The sons of Asher:
Imnah, Ishvah, Ishvi, Beriah, and Serah their sister.
The sons of Beriah were Heber and Malkiel.

texts.tb: Itulah <> keturunan <> Zilpa <>, yakni hamba perempuan yang <> telah diberikan <> Laban <> kepada Lea <>, anaknya <> perempuan, dan yang melahirkan <> anak-anak <> bagi Yakub <>; seluruhnya enam <> belas <> jiwa <>.
texts.bis: Keenam belas orang itu adalah keturunan Yakub dari Zilpa, yaitu hamba wanita yang diberikan Laban kepada Lea, anaknya perempuan.
texts.tl: Maka inilah <> anak-anak <> laki-laki Zilpa <>, yang <> diberi <> oleh Laban <> akan Lea <>, anaknya <>, maka yaitu semuanya diperanakkannya <> bagi Yakub <> enam <> belas <> orang banyaknya <>.
texts.ende: Itulah anak-anak Zilpa, jang diberikan oleh Laban kepada Lea, anak perempuannja; dia melahirkan enambelas orang tadi bagi Jakub.
texts.bbe: These are the children of Zilpah, whom Laban gave to his daughter Leah, and Jacob had these sixteen children by her.
texts.message: These are the children that Zilpah, the maid that Laban gave to his daughter Leah, bore to Jacob--sixteen of them.
texts.nkjv: These [were] the sons of Zilpah, whom Laban gave to Leah his daughter; and these she bore to Jacob: sixteen persons.
texts.net: These were the sons of Zilpah, whom Laban gave to Leah his daughter. She bore these to Jacob, sixteen in all.

texts.tb: Anak-anak <> Rahel <>, isteri <> Yakub <>, ialah Yusuf <> dan Benyamin <>.
texts.bis: Rahel istri Yakub mempunyai dua anak, yaitu Yusuf dan Benyamin.
texts.tl: Maka anak-anak <> laki-laki Rakhel <>, isteri <> Yakub <>, yaitu Yusuf <> dan Benyamin <>.
texts.ende: Anak-anak Rachel, isteri Jakub, ialah Jusuf dan Benjamin.
texts.bbe: The sons of Jacob�s wife Rachel: Joseph and Benjamin.
texts.message: The sons of Jacob's wife Rachel were Joseph and Benjamin.
texts.nkjv: The sons of Rachel, Jacob's wife, [were] Joseph and Benjamin.
texts.net:
The sons of Rachel the wife of Jacob: 
Joseph and Benjamin.

texts.tb: Bagi Yusuf <> lahir <> Manasye <> dan Efraim <> di tanah <> Mesir <>, yang <> dilahirkan <> baginya <> oleh Asnat <>, anak perempuan <> Potifera <>, imam <> di On <>.
texts.bis: Di Mesir Yusuf memperoleh dua anak, yaitu Manasye dan Efraim yang dilahirkan oleh istrinya Asnat, anak Potifera, yang menjabat imam di Heliopolis.
texts.tl: Maka bagi <> Yusufpun <> diperanakkan <> <> di negeri <> Mesir <> Manasye <> dan Efrayim <>, yang <> diperanakkan <> oleh Asenat <>, anak <> Potifera <>, imam <> di On <>.
texts.ende: Jusuf telah mendapat anak di Mesir, jakni Manasse dan Efraim, jang telah dilahirkan baginja oleh Asnat anak Potifera, imam di On.
texts.bbe: And Joseph had Manasseh and Ephraim in the land of Egypt, by Asenath, the daughter of Poti-phera, priest of On.
texts.message: Joseph was the father of two sons, Manasseh and Ephraim, from his marriage to Asenath daughter of Potiphera, priest of On. They were born to him in Egypt.
texts.nkjv: And to Joseph in the land of Egypt were born Manasseh and Ephraim, whom Asenath, the daughter of PotiPherah priest of On, bore to him.
texts.net: Manasseh and Ephraim were born to Joseph in the land of Egypt. Asenath daughter of Potiphera, priest of On,2830  On is another name for the city of Heliopolis. bore them to him.

texts.tb: Anak-anak <> Benyamin <> ialah Bela <>, Bekher <>, Asybel <>, Gera <>, Naaman <>, Ehi <>, Rosh <>, Mupim <>, Hupim <> dan Ared <>.
texts.bis: Benyamin; anak-anaknya: Bela, Bekher, Asybel, Gera, Naaman, Ehi, Ros, Mupim, Hupim dan Ared.
texts.tl: Maka anak-anak <> laki-laki Benyamin <>, yaitu Bela <> dan Bekher <> dan Asybel <> dan Gera <> dan Naaman <> dan Ekhi <> dan Rusy <> dan Mupim <> dan Hupim <> dan Ared <>.
texts.ende: Anak-anak Benjamin ialah Bela, Beker, Asjbel, Gera, Naaman, Echi, Rosj, Mupim, Chupim dan Ard.
texts.bbe: And the sons of Benjamin were Belah and Becher and Ashbel, Gera and Naaman, Ehi and Rosh, Muppim and Huppim and Ard.
texts.message: Benjamin's sons were Bela, Beker, Ashbel, Gera, Naaman, Ehi, Rosh, Muppim, Huppim, and Ard.
texts.nkjv: The sons of Benjamin [were] Belah, Becher, Ashbel, Gera, Naaman, Ehi, Rosh, Muppim, Huppim, and Ard.
texts.net:
The sons of Benjamin:2831  The sons of Benjamin. It is questionable whether youthful Benjamin had ten sons by the time he went into Egypt, but it is not impossible. If Benjamin was born when Joseph was six or seven, he was ten when Joseph was sold into Egypt, and would have been thirty-two at this point. Some suggest that the list originally served another purpose and included the names of all who were in the immediate family of the sons, whether born in Canaan or later in Egypt.
Bela, Beker, Ashbel, Gera, Naaman, Ehi, Rosh, Muppim, Huppim and Ard.

texts.tb: Itulah <> keturunan <> Rahel <>, yang <> telah lahir <> bagi Yakub <>, seluruhnya <> berjumlah <> empat <> belas <> jiwa.
texts.bis: Keempat belas orang itu adalah keturunan Yakub dari istrinya Rahel.
texts.tl: Maka sekalian inilah <> anak-anak <> laki-laki Rakhel <>, yang telah <> diperanakkan <> bagi Yakub <>, semuanya <> empat <> belas <> orang banyaknya <>.
texts.ende: Itulah anak-anak jang telah dilahirkan Rachel bagi Jakub, seluruhnja berdjumlah empatbelas orang.
texts.bbe: All these were the children of Rachel whom Jacob had by her, fourteen persons.
texts.message: These are the children born to Jacob through Rachel--fourteen.
texts.nkjv: These [were] the sons of Rachel, who were born to Jacob: fourteen persons in all.
texts.net: These were the sons of Rachel who were born to Jacob, fourteen in all.

texts.tb: Anak <> Dan <> ialah Husim <>.
texts.bis: Berikutnya Dan; anaknya Husim.
texts.tl: Maka anak <> laki-laki Dan <>, yaitu Khusim <>.
texts.ende: Anak-anak Dan ialah Chusjim.
texts.bbe: And the son of Dan was Hushim.
texts.message: Dan's son: Hushim.
texts.nkjv: The son of Dan [was] Hushim.
texts.net: The son of Dan: Hushim.2832  This name appears as “Shuham” in Num 26:42. The LXX reads “Hashum” here.

texts.tb: Anak-anak <> Naftali <> ialah Yahzeel <>, Guni <>, Yezer <> dan Syilem <>.
texts.bis: Naftali; anak-anaknya: Yahzeel, Guni, Yezer dan Syilem.
texts.tl: Maka anak-anak <> laki-laki Naftali <>, yaitu Yahziel <> dan Guni <> dan Yezer <> dan Syilem <>.
texts.ende: Anak-anak Neftali ialah Jachseel, Guni, Jeser dan Sjillem.
texts.bbe: And the sons of Naphtali: Jahzeel and Guni and Jezer and Shillem.
texts.message: Naphtali's sons: Jahziel, Guni, Jezer, and Shillem.
texts.nkjv: The sons of Naphtali [were] Jahzeel, Guni, Jezer, and Shillem.
texts.net:
The sons of Naphtali:
Jahziel, Guni, Jezer, and Shillem.

texts.tb: Itulah <> keturunan <> Bilha <>, yakni hamba perempuan yang <> diberikan <> Laban <> kepada Rahel <>, anaknya <> yang perempuan dan yang melahirkan <> anak-anak <> itu bagi Yakub <> --seluruhnya <> berjumlah <> tujuh <> jiwa.
texts.bis: Ketujuh orang itu adalah keturunan Yakub dari Bilha, hamba perempuan yang diberikan Laban kepada Rahel anaknya.
texts.tl: Maka inilah <> anak-anak <> laki-laki Bilha <>, yang <> diberikan <> oleh Laban <> kepada Rakhel <>, anaknya <>, maka diperanakkannya <> sekalian <> itu bagi Yakub <>, semuanya <> tujuh <> orang banyaknya <>.
texts.ende: Itulah anak-anak Bilha, jang diberikan oleh Laban kepada Rachel, anak perempuannja; dia melahirkan tudjuh orang itu tadi bagi Jakub.

Tell him, ‘Your servants have taken care of cattle2843  Heb “your servants are men of cattle.” from our youth until now, both we and our fathers,’ so that you may live in the land of Goshen,2844  So that you may live in the land of Goshen. Joseph is apparently trying to stress to Pharaoh that his family is self-sufficient, that they will not be a drain on the economy of Egypt. But they will need land for their animals and so Goshen, located on the edge of Egypt, would be a suitable place for them to live. texts.message: Egypt welcomes them. Settle your father and brothers on the choicest land--yes, give them Goshen. And if you know any among them that are especially good at their work, put them in charge of my own livestock."
texts.nkjv: "The land of Egypt [is] before you. Have your father and brothers dwell in the best of the land; let them dwell in the land of Goshen. And if you know [any] competent men among them, then make them chief herdsmen over my livestock."
texts.net: The land of Egypt is before you; settle your father and your brothers in the best region of the land. They may live in the land of Goshen. If you know of any highly capable men2852  Heb “men of skill.” among them, put them in charge2853  Heb “make them rulers.” Put them in charge of my livestock. Pharaoh is, in effect, offering Joseph’s brothers jobs as royal keepers of livestock, a position mentioned often in Egyptian inscriptions, because the Pharaohs owned huge herds of cattle. of my livestock.”

texts.bbe: And Joseph made a place for his father and his brothers, and gave them a heritage in the land of Egypt, in the best of the land, the land of Rameses, as Pharaoh had given orders.

He gave them territory2863  Heb “a possession,” or “a holding.” Joseph gave them a plot of land with rights of ownership in the land of Goshen. in the land of Egypt, in the best region of the land, the land of Rameses,2864  The land of Rameses is another designation for the region of Goshen. texts.bbe: Are we to come to destruction before your eyes, we and our land? take us and our land and give us bread; and we and our land will be servants to Pharaoh; and give us seed so that we may have life and the land may not become waste.
texts.message: What use are our bodies and our land if we stand here and starve to death right in front of you? Trade us food for our bodies and our land. We'll be slaves to Pharaoh and give up our land--all we ask is seed for survival, just enough to live on and keep the farms alive."
texts.nkjv: "Why should we die before your eyes, both we and our land? Buy us and our land for bread, and we and our land will be servants of Pharaoh; give [us] seed, that we may live and not die, that the land may not be desolate."
texts.net: Why should we die before your very eyes, both we and our land? Buy us and our land in exchange for food, and we, with our land, will become2874  After the imperative, the prefixed verbal form with vav here indicates consequence. Pharaoh’s slaves.2875  Pharaoh’s slaves. The idea of slavery is not attractive to the modern mind, but in the ancient world it was the primary way of dealing with the poor and destitute. Then the land will not become desolate.”2877  The disjunctive clause structure (vav [ו] + subject + negated verb) highlights the statement and brings their argument to a conclusion.

the Angel2931  The Samaritan Pentateuch reads “king” here, but the traditional reading (“angel”) may be maintained. Jacob closely associates God with an angelic protective presence. This does not mean that Jacob viewed his God as a mere angel, but it does suggest that he was aware of an angelic presence sent by God to protect him. Here he so closely associates the two that they become virtually indistinguishable. In this culture messengers typically carried the authority of the one who sent them and could even be addressed as such. Perhaps Jacob thought that the divine blessing would be mediated through this angelic messenger. who has protected me2932  The verb גָּאַל (ga’al) has the basic idea of “protect” as a near relative might do. It is used for buying someone out of bondage, marrying a deceased brother’s widow, paying off debts, avenging the family, and the like. The meanings of “deliver, protect, avenge” are most fitting when God is the subject (see A. R. Johnson, “The Primary Meaning of √גאל,” Congress Volume: Copenhagen, 1953 [VTSup], 67-77).
from all harm –

You are destructive2944  The Hebrew noun פַּחַז (pakhaz) only occurs here in the OT. A related verb occurs twice in the prophets (Jer 23:32; Zeph 3:4) for false prophets inventing their messages, and once in Judges for unscrupulous men bribed to murder (Judg 9:4). It would describe Reuben as being “frothy, boiling, turbulent” as water. The LXX has “run riot,” the Vulgate has “poured out,” and Tg. Onq. has “you followed your own direction.” It is a reference to Reuben’s misconduct in Gen 35, but the simile and the rare word invite some speculation. H. Pehlke suggests “destructive like water,” for Reuben acted with pride and presumption; see his “An Exegetical and Theological Study of Genesis 49:1-28” (Th.D. dissertation, Dallas Theological Seminary, 1985). like water and will not excel,2945  Heb “Do not excel!” The Hiphil of the verb יָתַר (yatar) has this meaning only here. The prophecy says that because of the character of the ancestor, the tribe of Reuben would not have the character to lead (see 1 Chr 5:1).

nor the ruler’s staff from between his feet,2952  Or perhaps “from his descendants,” taking the expression “from between his feet” as a euphemism referring to the genitals. In this case the phrase refers by metonymy to those who come forth from his genitals, i.e., his descendants.
until he comes to whom it belongs;2953  The Hebrew form שִׁילֹה (shiloh) is a major interpretive problem. There are at least four major options (with many variations and less likely alternatives): (1) Some prefer to leave the text as it is, reading “Shiloh” and understanding it as the place where the ark rested for a while in the time of the Judges. (2) By repointing the text others arrive at the translation “until the [or “his”] ruler comes,” a reference to a Davidic ruler or the Messiah. (3) Another possibility that does not require emendation of the consonantal text, but only repointing, is “until tribute is brought to him” (so NEB, JPS, NRSV), which has the advantage of providing good parallelism with the following line, “the nations will obey him.” (4) The interpretation followed in the present translation, “to whom it [belongs]” (so RSV, NIV, REB), is based on the ancient versions. Again, this would refer to the Davidic dynasty or, ultimately, to the Messiah.
the nations will obey him.2954  “and to him [will be] the obedience of the nations.” For discussion of this verse see J. Blenkinsopp, “The Oracle of Judah and the Messianic Entry,” JBL 80 (1961): 55-64; and E. M. Good, “The ‘Blessing’ on Judah,” JBL 82 (1963): 427-32.

texts.net:
Naphtali is a free running doe,2969  Heb “a doe set free.”
he speaks delightful words.2970  Heb “the one who gives words of beauty.” The deer imagery probably does not continue into this line; Naphtali is the likely antecedent of the substantival participle, which is masculine, not feminine, in form. If the animal imagery is retained from the preceding line, the image of a talking deer is preposterous. For this reason some read the second line “the one who bears beautiful fawns,” interpreting אִמְרֵי (’imre) as a reference to young animals, not words (see HALOT 67 s.v. *אִמֵּר). Almost every word in the verse is difficult. Some take the imagery to mean that Naphtali will be swift and agile (like a doe), and be used to take good messages (reading “words of beauty”). Others argue that the tribe was free-spirited (free running), but then settled down with young children.

texts.net:
Joseph is a fruitful bough,2971  The Hebrew text appears to mean “[is] a son of fruitfulness.” The second word is an active participle, feminine singular, from the verb פָּרָה (parah, “to be fruitful”). The translation “bough” is employed for בֵּן (ben, elsewhere typically “son”) because Joseph is pictured as a healthy and fruitful vine growing by the wall. But there are difficulties with this interpretation. The word “son” nowhere else refers to a plant and the noun translated “branches” (Heb “daughters”) in the third line is a plural form whereas its verb is singular. In the other oracles of Gen 49 an animal is used for comparison and not a plant, leading some to translate the opening phrase בֵּן פָּרָה (ben parah, “fruitful bough”) as “wild donkey” (JPS, NAB). Various other interpretations involving more radical emendation of the text have also been offered.
a fruitful bough near a spring
whose branches2972  Heb “daughters.” climb over the wall.

texts.bbe: And they came to the grain-floor of Atad on the other side of Jordan, and there they gave the last honours to Jacob, with great and bitter sorrow, weeping for their father for seven days.
texts.message: Arriving at the Atad Threshing Floor just across the Jordan River, they stopped for a period of mourning, letting their grief out in loud and lengthy lament. For seven days, Joseph engaged in these funeral rites for his father.
texts.nkjv: Then they came to the threshing floor of Atad, which [is] beyond the Jordan, and they mourned there with a great and very solemn lamentation. He observed seven days of mourning for his father.
texts.net: When they came to the threshing floor of Atad3003  The location of the threshing floor of Atad is not certain. The expression the other side of the Jordan could refer to the eastern or western bank, depending on one’s perspective. However, it is commonly used in the OT for Transjordan. This would suggest that the entourage came up the Jordan Valley and crossed into the land at Jericho, just as the Israelites would in the time of Joshua. on the other side of the Jordan, they mourned there with very great and bitter sorrow.3004  Heb “and they mourned there [with] very great and heavy mourning.” The cognate accusative, as well as the two adjectives and the adverb, emphasize the degree of their sorrow. There Joseph observed a seven day period of mourning for his father.

texts.bis: Lalu Yusuf menyuruh semua sanak saudaranya bersumpah, katanya, "Berjanjilah kepada saya, bahwa apabila Allah memimpin kalian ke negeri itu, kalian akan membawa juga jenazah saya."
texts.tl: Maka disuruhlah <> oleh Yusuf <> akan bani <> Israel <> itu bersumpah, katanya <>: Bahwa sesungguhnya <> Allah <> akan <> mengunjungi <> kamu <>, maka pada masa itu takkan jangan kamu membawa <> membawa <> akan tulang-tulangku <> dari sini <>.
texts.ende: Jusuf lalu menjuruh anak-anak Israel bersumpah, katanja: "Apabila Allah kelak mengundjungi kamu, kamu harus membawa tulang-tulangku dari sini!"
texts.bbe: Then Joseph made the children of Israel take an oath, saying, God will certainly give effect to his word, and you are to take my bones away from here.
texts.message: Then Joseph made the sons of Israel promise under oath, "When God makes his visitation, make sure you take my bones with you as you leave here."
texts.nkjv: Then Joseph took an oath from the children of Israel, saying, "God will surely visit you, and you shall carry up my bones from here."
texts.net: Joseph made the sons of Israel swear an oath. He said, “God will surely come to you. Then you must carry my bones up from this place.”

texts.tb: Kemudian matilah <> Yusuf <>, berumur <> seratus <> sepuluh <> tahun <>. Mayatnya dirempah-rempahi <>, dan ditaruh <> dalam peti mati <> <> di Mesir <>.
texts.bis: Kemudian meninggallah Yusuf di Mesir pada usia seratus sepuluh tahun. Mereka merempah-rempahi jenazahnya dan menaruhnya dalam peti mati.
texts.tl: Hata, maka Yusufpun <> matilah <> pada seratus <> sepuluh <> tahun <> umurnya <>, maka dirempah-rempahi <> oranglah <> akan dia, lalu ditaruhlah <> akan dia dalam sebuah keranda <> di negeri Mesir <>.
texts.ende: Kemudian Jusuf meninggal pada usia seratus sepuluh tahun. Djenazahnja dirempah-rempahi dan ditaruh didalam peti djenazah di Mesir.
texts.bbe: So Joseph came to his death, being a hundred and ten years old: and they made his body ready, and he was put in a chest in Egypt.
texts.message: Joseph died at the age of 110 years. They embalmed him and placed him in a coffin in Egypt.
texts.nkjv: So Joseph died, [being] one hundred and ten years old; and they embalmed him, and he was put in a coffin in Egypt.
